metadata.title: CVE-2024-25744 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel before 6.6.7, an untrusted VMM can trigger int80syscall handling at any given point. This is related toarch/x86/coco/tdx/tdx.c and arch/x86/mm/mem_encrypt_amd.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-25744` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-227-generic - 4.15.0-227.239
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-227-generic - 4.15.0-227.239
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-227-lowlatency - 4.15.0-227.239
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1154-kvm - 4.15.0-1154.159
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1170-aws - 4.15.0-1170.183
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1179-azure - 4.15.0-1179.194
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
